Package eu.tivian.hardware

Class MOS8501

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.tivian.hardware.MOS8501
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CPU
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCPU
    public class MOS8501
extends Object
implements CPU
    An implementation of MOS8501 - the 8-bit CPU from 1985 used in the Commodore 16.
    Since:
    2019-11-06
    Author:
    Pawe≈Ç Kania
    See Also:
    MOS8501 datasheet, 6500 Family Programming Manual

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  MOS8501.Addressing
      The addressing modes.
      static interface  MOS8501.AddressingMode
      Functor used for decoding the instructions.
      static interface  MOS8501.Operation
      Functor used for executing the instructions.
      static class  MOS8501.Stage
      Possible stages of instruction execution.
      class  MOS8501.Status
      CPU status register.

        Hardwired IRQ vector.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ANE_MAGIC

        protected static final byte ANE_MAGIC
        Value for unofficial ANE instruction.
        Taken from my own C64.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LXA_MAGIC

        protected static final byte LXA_MAGIC
        Value for unofficial LXA instruction.
        Taken from my own C64.
        See Also:

      • SR

        protected byte SR
        Status registry.

      • PC

        protected short PC
        Program counter.

      • AC

        protected byte AC
        Accumulator.

      • XR

        protected byte XR
        X index registry.

      • YR

        protected byte YR
        Y index registry.

      • SP

        protected byte SP
        Stack pointer.

      • status

        protected final MOS8501.Status status
        CPU status registry singleton.

      • phi0

        public final Pin phi0
        Clock input. Pin 1

      • rdy

        public final Pin rdy
        Ready signal. Pin 2
        When held LOW for more than 3 cycles then the CPU will halt.

      • irq

        public final Pin irq
        Interrupt input. Pin 3
        LOW level means the interrupt occured.

      • aec

        public final Pin aec
        Address enable control. Pin 4
        When held LOW the address bus pins becomes isolated from the bus.

      • gate

        public final Pin gate
        Gate in. Pin 23
        For memory management. Prevents unwanted writes to the RAM.

      • rw

        public final Pin rw
        Read/write signal. Pin 39
        LOW logic level mean it's a write cycle, otherwise it's a read cycle.

      • reset

        public final Pin reset
        Reset pin. Pin 40
        After transition from LOW to HIGH the CPU will restart itself.

      • address

        public final Bus address
        Address bus. Pins 6 - 19, 21, 22

      • data

        public final Bus data
        Data bus. Pins 31 - 38

      • port

        public final Bus port
        CPU IO port. Pins 24 - 30
        In 8501/7501 this port is 7-pins wide.

      • halt

        protected boolean halt
        CPU halt flag.
        If true then the CPU is halted.

      • irqPending

        protected boolean irqPending
        Denotes the pending interrupt request.

      • maskIRQ

        protected boolean maskIRQ
        Denotes if situation occurred which prevents interrupt request from being processed.
        Due to a design flaw it's possible to mask the interrupt.

      • rdyCounter

        protected byte rdyCounter
        Counts how many consecutive cycles the RDY pin was held LOW.
        If this value exceed 3 cycles then the CPU halts its operation.

      • stage

        protected MOS8501.Stage stage
        Current stage of instruction processing.

      • decodeCycle

        byte decodeCycle
        Current cycle in decoding the addressing mode.

      • decoding

        protected MOS8501.AddressingMode decoding
        Functor for addressing mode decoding.

      • isAccu

        protected boolean isAccu
        Denotes if current one byte instruction is in implied or accumulator mode.

      • cycles

        protected long cycles
        CPU cycles counter.

      • opcode

        protected byte opcode
        Current opcode.

      • lastPos

        protected short lastPos
        Program counter value of last opcode.

      • operand

        protected byte operand
        Current instruction operand.

      • ea

        protected short ea
        Calculated effective address.

      • pointer

        protected short pointer
        Temporary pointer.
        Used in indexed zeropage addressing.

      • offset

        protected byte offset
        Branch offset.
        Used in relative addressing.

      • halfCycleOut

        protected Consumer<Byte> halfCycleOut
        Functor for handling the output data during the halfcycle.

      • halfCycleIn

        protected Supplier<Byte> halfCycleIn
        Functor for handing the input data during the halfcycle.

      • lastData

        protected Byte lastData
        Data used in last write cycle.
        Saved in case of gate in signal transition.

      • mnemonic

        protected static final String[] mnemonic
        Mnemonics for all of 256 CPU instructions.

      • undocumented

        protected static final List<String> undocumented
        List of undocumented instructions.
        In most cases if CPU wants to execute any of them, then probably the CPU doesn't behave as it should.

      • useUndocumented

        protected static boolean useUndocumented
        Dictates if the use of undocumented instruction will cause exception.

      • result

        private short result
        Result of the latest operation.

      • addr

        protected final MOS8501.Addressing addr
        A singleton of addressing mode decoding stages.

      • modes

        protected final MOS8501.AddressingMode[] modes
        Addressing modes list.

      • ops

        private final Map<String,​MOS8501.Operation> ops
        The CPU instruction implementations.
        See Also:
        MCS6500 Microcomputer Family Programming Manual, 1976, 6502 Instruction Set

      • MOS8501

        public MOS8501()
        Initializes events for all input pins.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        protected void read​(short address)
        Reads the memory and discards the result.
        Parameters:
        address - the memory address

      • read

        protected void read​(short address,
                    Consumer<Byte> readCycle)
        Reads the memory
        Parameters:
        address - the memory address
        readCycle - functor for received data

      • write

        protected void write​(short address,
                     byte value)
        Writes to the memory.
        Parameters:
        address - the memory address
        value - value to write

      • pull

        private void pull()
        Pulls the value from the stack and discards it.

      • pull

        private void pull​(Consumer<Byte> operation)
        Pulls the value from the stack.
        Parameters:
        operation - functor for received data

      • push

        private void push​(byte value)
        Pushes the value onto the stack.
        Also decrements the stack pointer, because after all push operations the SP need to be decremented anyway.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to push

      • accuOrMem

        private void accuOrMem()
        Writes to memory or accumulator depending on value of isAccu.

      • opCMP

        private void opCMP​(byte reg)
        Compares the memory with given register.
        Parameters:
        reg - the register to compare

      • ready

        private void ready()
        Behaviour of the RDY pin. After 3 cycles of RDY held LOW the CPU halts its operation.

      • aec

        private void aec()
        Behaviour of the AEC pin. When held LOW the address bus pins are isolated from the bus.

      • gateIn

        private void gateIn()
        Bahaviour of the GATE_IT pin. Prevents unwanted writes to the RAM memory.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        Behaviour of the RESET pin.
        When held LOW the CPU is halted, and after transition to HIGH its state is restarted.

      • halfstep

        protected void halfstep()
        Manages the data coming in to or out from the CPU when clock signal is HIGH.

      • step

        protected void step()
        Calculates the current state of the CPU.

      • isHalted

        public boolean isHalted()
        Returns true if CPU is halted.
        Returns:
        true if CPU is halted
